sentences.english: He also said that if a similar incident occurs in the future, Japan will resolutely deal with it.
sentences.chinese: 今後如再次出現類似情況，日方將繼續毅然應對。

sentences.english: Took back-to-back to more distant light years.
sentences.chinese: 毅然背對揹走向更遠的光年。

sentences.english: She assailed her studies with new determination.
sentences.chinese: 她滿懷新的決心毅然對付學習。

sentences.english: Jane resolutely kept her place at the table;
sentences.chinese: 吉英毅然決然地坐在桌位上不動。

sentences.english: Grandpa see this situation, resolutely decided to go back.
sentences.chinese: 爺爺看到他們的這個狀況，毅然決定回去。

sentences.english: Wang Yung-ching to see this, we took the decision to withdraw from the timber industry.
sentences.chinese: 王永慶看到這一點，便毅然決定退出木材行業。

sentences.english: Rub a medical table, resolutely away, but also what?
sentences.chinese: 揉了體檢表，毅然決然地離去，又能怎樣？

sentences.english: Stepped forward determinedly, Mr. Johnson looked at the long road ahead of him.
sentences.chinese: 約翰遜先生望着面前漫長的道路毅然挺身而出。

sentences.english: At the period of "Wusi" , the intellect of China broke firmly with traditional culture.
sentences.chinese: “五四”時期，中國知識分子毅然與傳統文化決裂。

sentences.english: He redeemed his honour by resigning resolutely.
sentences.chinese: 他毅然辭職，以挽回自己的聲譽。

sentences.english: Million Shijun for solutions, resolutely promised two town antipathy.
sentences.chinese: 時俊爲解兩鎮宿怨，毅然答應。

sentences.english: If the love becomes to the bitter wine, and put down determinedly.
sentences.chinese: 如果愛已變成苦酒，就毅然地放下執着。

sentences.english: Chihiro decided to accept help him take a shower.
sentences.chinese: 千尋毅然接受幫他洗澡的重任。

sentences.english: He told me this with a straight face but watched my eyes closely as he spoke.
sentences.chinese: 說話時表情毅然決然，但在和我眼神接觸時閉着雙眼。

sentences.english: And if you go in, should you turn left or right?
sentences.chinese: 若你毅然前進，那要左轉還是右行？

sentences.english: Chihiro decided to accept the responsibility to help him take a bath.
sentences.chinese: 千尋毅然接受幫他洗澡的重任。

definition: honor does not allow one to glance back (idiom); duty-bound not to turn back/no surrender/to pursue justice with no second thoughts
to act against one's will/to have no alternative but to/to have to/to have no choice/must
to glance back/fig. to regret/to have second thoughts about sth
to stand one's ground against the opinion of the masses (idiom)
to be determined to/to insist on
